trial_identification.studytitle: Accelerated diagnostic process for selected low risk emergency department (ED) patients with chest pain
trial_identification.scientifictitle: For selected low risk ED patients with non-traumatic chest pain, can an accelerated diagnostic protocol safely rule out acute coronary syndrome and major adverse cardiac events at 30 days

interventions.interventions: Troponin I testing at ED presentation, 2 hours and 4 hours later performed on a sample of 5-10mls of venous blood

primaryOutcome.outcome: Occurence of major adverse cardiac events defined as prevalent or incident myocardial infarction, death, cardiac arrest or serious arrhythmia or emergent revascularisation.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Predictive performance of GRACE Freedom from events score
Predictive performance of TIMI score for MI
Predictive performance of undetectable troponin level at ED presentation for MI

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Adult patients presenting to ED with atraumatic chest pain of <24 hours duration
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Clear ECG evidence of ACS No ECG or biomarker assay within 24 hours of chest pain Clear alternative diagnosis at initial assessment Decline consent to followup/ unavailable for followup

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Joseph Epstein Centre for Emergency Medicine Research at Western Health
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Sunshine Hospital Furlong Road St Albans VIC 3021

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The assessment of patients presenting to Ed with chest pain aims to identify acute coronary artery syndrome (ACS) promptly and rule out ACS efficiently. This project aims to validate a 2 hour rapid rule out process and the GRACE Freedom for events score.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Western Hospital Low Risk Ethics Panel
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Office for Research Sunshine Hospital Furlong Road St Albans VIC 3021

contact.name: Anne-Maree Kelly
contact.address: JECEMR Sunshine Hospital Furlong Road, St Albans VIC 3021
